Reviews.Title: Fabulous image quality but less reach
Reviews.Author: Roger J. Buffington
Reviews.Content: I have used both the TC-17E II and this one, the TC-14E II.  This one multiplies the reach of a zoom lens by only 1.4.  There are two other Nikon teleconverters in this series, the TC-17E II (1.7 multiplier) and the TC-20E II (2.0 times multiplier).  The "E II" series of teleconverters is only suitable for certain Nikon lenses--check the Nikon website for compatability.  I purchased this teleconverter for use with the 70-200VR F/2.8 lens, with which it is quite compatible.All teleconverters introduce at least a theoretical degradation in image quality in exchange for the extra reach; the extent of this can range from the unnoticeable to the significant.  The TC-14E II does not degrade the images from the 70-200VR to any perceptible extent.  Even when shooting with wide aperture settings this teleconverter does not appear to introduce any noticeable decrease in lens image quality.  Further, it only lowers the light sensitivity of a lens by one F Stop.  This means that a 2.8 lens will become a 4.0 lens when using this teleconverter--still pretty fast. The TC-14E II is noticeably sharper than the TC-17E II in lower light conditions requiring wider apertures (at the cost of less "reach" or magnification). I have been extremely impressed with the combination of the TC-14E II and the Nikon 70-200VR.  The magnification is significant, and the decrease in image quality is undetectable.Most Nikon afficianados seem to think that the 17E II is the best compromise between not too much image degradation and significant magnification, and I am inclined to agree with this, generally.  The charm of the 14E is that it really does appear not to exact any appreciable price in terms of image quality, and it is the only teleconverter I have ever used (or heard of) of which this can be said.  The qualities of the 14E II become evident when shooting in low light conditions, such as early morning wildlife shots.  When shooting flying birds, for instance, this TC is particularly useful, because it allows wider apertures, which may be required to allow the photographer to use faster shutter speeds to "freeze" the subjects and avoid motion blur.  Under such conditions, one appreciates the special qualities of the TC-14E II.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: If You Want More Zoom and Minimal Distortion
Reviews.Author: JME
Reviews.Content: I bought this converter for the Nikon 70-200mm VR lens to cover extend my range when I upgraded from a D300 to a D3 and lost the 1.5x factor I had with the D300.  It works great with my f/2.8 70-200mm VR lens and the results are sharp at f/4 (the minimum aperture for the aforementioned lens with the tele, but the pictures really shine when stopped down to f/5.6. It's worth the investment, easy to carry around.  I thank Ken Rockwell for advising me on this product and guiding me to Amazon's exceptional service.  This product really makes a difference, less cropping needed for those hard to reach shots.

Reviews.Title: A perfect tool for any photographer Pro or Amateur
Reviews.Author: Steven P. Johnson "Steven Johnson"
Reviews.Content: I bought this converter for the Nikon 70-200mm VR lens to cover football. I shoot free-lance for multiple publications and I have successfully covered college football with this converter and the 70-200mm VR lens. I would suggest this to any friend, photographer, pro or amateur. The 1.4 is plenty for the extra zoom and when put on a 300mm f/2.8 It is a god-send.

Reviews.Title: Teleconverter (1.4)
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Ward
Reviews.Content: The service for the delivery of this product was good. The teleconverter it self is great. I can extend the focusing magnification to an extra 100 mm on my 70-200mm lens. This making it 300 mm. I did not notice at all a reduction in sharpness. I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: 1.4 X = love
Reviews.Author: dmbTank
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you need a little extra reach. This teleconverter adds 1.4 magnification to your lens. So, a 150mm will be a 210mm.These Nikon teleconverters are compatible with a number of lenses but they work best with faster prime or fast zooms (2.8 ./ 3.5).Nikon has a compatibility chart to check if your Nikkor works with the teleconverter.Small and very compact, makes sense to carry almost always when you are out.The performance is outstanding.  I am not a pixel counter, so I don't go looking for issues; here are few low light shots of a hummer;http://www.truetoad.com/ToadBytes/ArtMID/510/ArticleID/28/Hummers-for-the-Summer.aspxThese were taken with the teleconverter on a 70-200 late afternoon.I don't notice any difference in sharpness when using the 1.4x.The teleconverter works great with a Nikkor 105mm Macro lens as well.

Reviews.Title: This is one TC that matches the optical quality of Pro-Class lenses.
Reviews.Author: Michael Harvey
Reviews.Content: As an addition to the 300mm f/2.8 Nikkor, there is simply no observable loss of sharpness or contrast. Images with and without the TC, compared side-by-side at 100% are indistinguishable except for the larger scale of the 1.4X.

Reviews.Title: Nikon TC-14EII teleconverter is so helpful and useful.
Reviews.Author: Marcella L. Clark
Reviews.Content: This item makes my photography sessions all the more pleasant because the objects appear to be so clear and precise and the wonderful feature of just "bringing the subject up so close" is wonderful.  A friend recommended this item to me and I am grateful to him for that.  I especially enjoy bird and wildlife photography so this teleconverter makes each session much more successful.  Since I am having better luck with my photos, I seem to want to just shoot photos all the time - to heck with dishes, cleaning, and other annoying chores.  More pictures.!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality!
Reviews.Author: D. Asher "Dave"
Reviews.Content: I use this with a Nikon 70-200 f2.8 zoom lens and the quality is excellent. I haven't noticed any deterioration in the sharpness and focus of the f 2.8 when the converter is attached.  I tried the TC 2.0 and the TC 1.7 and cant say the same for either so I returned one and ended up selling the other. Please be aware however that this will not work with some of the low-end kit zoom lens.  I am very pleased with the TC-14E II.

Reviews.Title: Numero uno
Reviews.Author: tracht3
Reviews.Content: High end.  Perfect match with Nikkor 70-200mm vr2.  No image quality loss.  Opens more dimension for lens.  Only lose 1 f stop

Reviews.Title: Amazing TC!
Reviews.Author: Baduy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for 70-200  2.8 vrII and 300  f4.. I don't make reviews but this tc is just great..  Fast AF and the quality of the image is the same as if you dont have it on the lens.  Don't have the reach as far as the tc20 but with d800 , if you need more distance.. you just crop it or use it on DX mode problem solved.  Great product! I'm very happy with it. Worth what I paid for!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous extra magnification for a macro lens
Reviews.Author: Rob Hemphill
Reviews.Content: I bought the TC-14E II to match up with my Nikon AF-S VR Micro-Nikkor 105mm f/2.8G IF-ED macro lens so I could get even closer while shooting small creatures and flowers. The results have been amazing. You will always need to use a tripod to avoid camera shake at this close distance, and on top of that don't take photos by pressing the button, as any slight movement will be magnified by an extra 1.4x - especially with a macro lens, so set the timer delay or better still use a remote or release cable. It takes practise getting crystal clear focus, so don't rely on auto focus at all. I always use aperture or shutter priority so that everything can be fine tuned manually.I contemplated getting either the TC-17E II (1.7x) or TC-20E II (2.0x) as well, but thought there was a possibility of too much image degradation. I stuck with the TC-14E II, and am really satisfied with it as there's always a trade-off between magnification and quality. The TC-14E II lowers the light sensitivity of a lens by just one F Stop, therefore an f2.8 lens turns into an f3.8 lens - which is still pretty fast for most purposes.Another real bonus of the TC-14E II comes when shooting in low light conditions. Allowing for wider apertures and faster shutter speeds, this enables subjects to be frozen so reducing motion blur. This teleconverter now never leaves my macro lens, I love it!

Reviews.Title: Good solution for D700
Reviews.Author: Dong Heon Han "Donnie Han"
Reviews.Content: 70-200 is not so telephoto to me for D700. 70-300 has not so fast for inside.TC-14C II makes 70-200 F2.8 to 100-300 F4, and I could use this inside and out,and image quality is almost stays same.It is good solution for telephoto for D700.

Reviews.Title: Great teleconverter
Reviews.Author: b.deren "b.deren"
Reviews.Content: Had problems deciding between the 1.4, 1.7 and 2.0.  Bought the 1.4 because of absolutely lowest distortion to the picture.  I pretty much leave it on my 70-200 VRII all the time.  I've also used it on my 105mm macro without any problems.I will skip the 1.7 and get 2.0 in the future for when I need the extra reach. Very nice finish that matches pro lenses.

Reviews.Title: Great but not long enough
Reviews.Author: SRH
Reviews.Content: The teleconverter is excellent concerning image quality but just does not extend the range long enough for most situations. I just returned from shooting wildlife in Yellowstone and much preferred the 1.7 over this one.

Reviews.Title: Little loss of clarity
Reviews.Author: dennis barry
Reviews.Content: I bought this yo take to Africa for a photo safari and was well pleased with the results. I'd recommend it for anyone considering wildlife photography from a safe distance.

Reviews.Title: Great addition
Reviews.Author: Cindywmsig
Reviews.Content: Works well with the Nikkor 300 mm.  Would recommend .  I have had no problems with this extender.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Gets me out there just a little farther
Reviews.Author: marpater
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to extend the reach of your f/2.8 lens then this is the item for you, just make sure it's compatible with the lenses you intend to connect this to, it doesn't fit all of the Nikon product. Great quality with 1-2 stops lost, go for it, its less expensive than filling the gap between that 300 & 500.

Reviews.Title: The Great Extender!
Reviews.Author: fstopal
Reviews.Content: The Nikon TC-14E II (1.4) works very well on my Nikon 300mm f2.8 lens and the images remain quite sharp. I also love the nice bokah! I am looking forward to using it on my 500mm f4 as well.

Reviews.Title: Met expectations fully.
Reviews.Author: Roger Harms
Reviews.Content: After about 200 shots, fully satisfied.  Fast, no impediment of autofocus, sharply in focus, no evidence of distortion.  Completely happy thus far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Hamid Moham
Reviews.Content: I've just used this TC on a Nikon 7000 with 2 lenses : Nikon 70-200mm f 4 & Nikon 105mm (Marcro). With the former it gives you a 280mm & with the latter a 150mm.  As mentioned by others, there's no noticeable loss of quality in any sense with either lens.  The AF works quickly & accurately at all times.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Pricey, but worth it.
Reviews.Author: Elliott Glick
Reviews.Content: I use this with 20-200mm f/2.8, 200mm f2.0 and 200-400mm f/2.8. In my opinion it adds more than a stop to the shot, but in daylight it works fantastic with very clear results throughout the image. At night events I only use it with the 200 f/2.0 with good to very good results in poor lighting such as night football and other youth sports. I also have the TC-17E, but that is strictly a daylight device. These are not the optimum way to get longer telephoto shots, but even at this price it beats the price of decent 500mm and 600mm lenses with very good results and way more easy to tote to remote locations.

Reviews.Title: Nikon TC-14E (1.4x)
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: Ordered Nikon TC-14E II (1.4x) teleconverter AF-S.  Received Nikon TC-14E (1.4x) teleconverter AF-S.  Both are one in the same except for the upgraded stamping on the converter.  The seller should have noted this in his description instead of selling it as the new version.  I am, however, satisified with what I received and it does as it was intended.

Reviews.Title: Extra Reach
Reviews.Author: REM
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to match up with the AF 200-400mm f4 VR Nikon to give me that bit of extra reach when photographing birds.  It does just that.  The resolution of the image is near perfect. However when shooting at f4 in low light situations the auto focus has some trouble.  At 5.6 and above it does fine.  I opted for the 1.4 over the 2.0 as I shoot in low light more often than not. The extra magnification wasn't worth the light loss.  I wasn't impressed by what I had heard about the 1.7 although a few pros match it with the above lens. This is a nice addition to my camera equipment.  I am very pleaed with it at this point

Reviews.Title: Good and it works!
Reviews.Author: Edgar H. Tan, MD "The Healer"
Reviews.Content: I am just an occasional shooter who needs this only occasionally....for me it's good to be ready so you can have it when the need arises...

Reviews.Title: Didn't perform well with the Nikon 70-200mm f/4G ED VR Nikkor Zoom Lens
Reviews.Author: N. Paoni
Reviews.Content: I purchased this teleconverter to extend the reach of the Nikon 70-200mm f/4G ED VR Nikkor Zoom Lens.  The purchase was made based on very good reviews from photographers using this teleconverter with the 70-200 f/2.8.  Unfortunately there was a marked reduction in image quality with the f/4 lens and I ended up returning the teleconverter for a full refund.
